resources.string: Winline is a one player puzzle game. It is base on the classic Colour Line game. The player can move one ball per turn to a particular place if there is a path (linked set of vertical and horizontal empty cells) between the current position of the ball and the desired destination. The goal is to score the most points removing balls by forming lines (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) of at least five balls of the same colour. If the player does form such lines of at least five balls of the same colour, the balls in those lines disappear, adding the number of balls that disappear to the overall player points, and he gains one turn, e.g. he can move another ball. If not, three new balls are added (at random colour and position), and the game continues until the board is either full or empty.

Note: you won\'t get points for a configuration of five or more balls in a row if you last moved ball is not part of such configuration (e.g. five or more in a row caused by random allocation of the three new balls added).

To play you only need to touch on the ball you want to move and then touch in an empty cell. If there is a path between the position of the ball and the desired destination the ball will move. You also can save your current game touching on the most right button at the board bottom, create a new game using the button in the center and load a saved game with the button most to the left.

The combo feature is a way to give the player the opportunity to increments the points by rewarding consecutive scores. Any time the player scores a countdown will be start, during this time a subsequent score will multiply the points involved in the score by a number starting in 2 and incrementing consecutively in 1 and reset the countdown. If the time pass without a score the multiplier will reset to 2.
